alert.note: Alert for Phelps (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 8:43AM CDT until May 09 at 4:52PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and east central Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Pulaski. In east central Missouri, Phelps. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 843 AM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the warned area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Little Piney Creek at Highway H, Smoky Hollow at Highway J, Norman Creek at County Road 4220, Tavern Creek at Highway U and Jones Creek at Highway O. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rolla, Fort Leonard Wood, Waynesville, St. Robert, St. James, Richland, Dixon and Crocker. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
